Html:
Greetings, I've checked this project out and it looks most excellent! Very cool tool.

I have a few questions about it:
  • Is this tool using the Google Maps API v2 or v3?
  • Is there an API difference between the download on the main page (1.6 Power) and the latest changes from the stable branch?
V2 is going to be deprecated as of in about a week (May 19) or a few months (November 19, 2013) see [https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/geocoding/v2/](The API Homepage). What will no longer work when that happens?

I plan to use an OpenStreetMaps source as my primary source, but there have been requests to include Google Maps. If GMap.NET is using API v2 I'd rather just drop Google Maps to avoid trouble :)

Does GMap.NET also use the Geocoding API? If so, which version?

It looks like SetCurrentPositionByKeywords() uses Google's Geocoding API as a GeocodingProvider.

Edit:
How are Bing / Yahoo / other commercial providers with this project? Are any of them opposed like Google is?

radioman,

Cool thanks! Does 1.6 (power) released on Mon Oct 17, 2011 use v2? Or does that release use v3 too?

What is best way to get latest build?

Last commit to default?

https://greatmaps.codeplex.com/SourceControl/list/changesets

Thanks.

Thanks for your help, radioman.

I'll be evaluating the May 9th build (https://greatmaps.codeplex.com/SourceControl/changeset/317bcc1ac95b)

How stable of a beta would you say this is?

Thanks.

hrm, the beta is not working so well for me. (render errors. see https://greatmaps.codeplex.com/discussions/443994)

Can you confirm for sure if 1.6 (power) released on Mon Oct 17, 2011 use v3 Google Maps API? I'm willing to make a donation to your project (~$50 USD) if you can confirm the version of Google Maps API being used in the official 1.6 release of GMaps.NET.

I would need a code snippet confirming the Google Maps API version being used.

Thanks.
everything works quite perfect, don't bitch

I am making another $250 donation, regardless. This project is phenomenal and has solved so many problems for me over the last couple of years. Thanks for your continued hard work on this, I hope folks truly appreciate the power and capability of this product. Great freaking job!
